title: Revert is slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: When I answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, it works fine. However, if I repeat these steps and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
OB: When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: Reverting the file contents should not take longer than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the Java editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. When prompted to save changes, choose 'No'.
4. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5. Notice that it works fine.
6. Repeat steps 1-4.
7. This time, select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
8. Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
